      Backwater valves shall be installed so that access is provided to the
working parts for service and repair. If installed under concrete or asphalt
paving (i.e., sidewalks, driveways or parking areas), backwater valves shall be
installed in a permanent box or access enclosure whose lid is flush with grade.
If installed under soil or ground cover vegetation, a backwater valve shall be
installed in a permanent box or access enclosure whose lid is flush with grade
or above.
   Section 305.4.1. Insert "18 inches for sewer line depth" Section 903.1.
Insert "36 inches". (Ord. 1182, 9-8-2015; amd. Ord. 1280, 11-8-2022)
5-2-2: PERMIT AND FEES:
   A.   Permit Required; Payment Of Fee: Before any work is commenced on any
job which is governed by the provisions of this chapter, a permit shall be
obtained from the community services office. The fees for such permits shall be
as set by the city council from time to time by motion or resolution. A copy of
the current fee schedule shall be kept in the office of the city clerk.
   B.   Property Owner Performing Work: Nothing in this code shall prohibit a
property owner from performing plumbing work on his primary residence of
record. This provision shall not be construed to allow the property owner to
forgo the requirements of obtaining a lawful permit or to hire unlicensed
persons to perform plumbing work. (Ord. 1182, 9-8-2015)
5-2-3: LICENSING AND BONDING OF PLUMBERS:
   The sections of the plumbing code governing licensing and bonding of
plumbers are hereby amended as follows:
   A.   General: Before any person, firm or corporation shall engage in the
plumbing business, he shall be qualified as set forth herein, and a license
shall be obtained from the city and state as required. Where any plumbing work
is being done, a master or journeyman plumber shall at all times be present on
the job, and in actual control, and in charge of the work being done.
   B.   Qualification Of Plumbers: Any person who desires to enter the plumbing
business or offers plumbing services shall appear before the governing
authority to satisfy the governing authority as to his competency to enter the
plumbing business.
   C.   Issuance Of License: Licenses shall be obtained from the proper
municipal authority upon proof of compliance with state licensing requirements.
   D.   Illegal Work, Revocation Of License:
      1.   Any person, firm or corporation engaged in the plumbing business
whose work does not conform to the rules and regulations hereinafter set out,
or whose workmanship or materials are of inferior quality, shall, upon notice
from the plumbing official, make necessary changes or corrections at once so as
to conform to this code. If work has not been so changed after ten (10) days'
notice from the plumbing official, the plumbing official shall then refuse to
issue any more permits until such work has fully complied with the rules and
regulations of this chapter.
      2.   The plumbing official shall have the authority to revoke any license
for continuous violations of this title or for good cause shown.
      3.   When the revocation of any such license is to be considered, the
person, firm, company, association, or corporation to whom the license has been
issued shall have at least three (3) days' notice in writing of the time and
place of a revocation hearing, together with a statement of the grounds upon
which it is proposed to revoke such license.
   E.   Allowing Permit To Be Obtained Fraudulently: No person, firm or
corporation engaged in the business of plumbing shall allow his or its name to
be used by any other person, firm or corporation, directly or indirectly, to
obtain a permit, or for the construction of any work under his or its name,
license or bond; nor shall he or it make any misrepresentations or omissions in
his or its returns.
   F.   City Authority Regarding Applicability Of Provisions: The provisions of
this title and the 2015 international plumbing code are not mutually exclusive
and the municipal authority shall have the ability to elect the applicable
provision so long as the general health, safety and welfare of the public are
considered. (Ord. 1182, 9-8-2015)
5-2-4: PLUMBING AND GAS CONTRACTORS:
   A.   License Required; Fees: There is hereby required a license to be issued
by the community services director to each person, firm or corporation, before
he engages in the activity of a plumbing and/or gas contractor. The annual fee
for such license shall be payable in advance in the sum of two hundred dollars
($200.00) for the first year and payable in advance in the sum of fifty dollars
($50.00) for each subsequent year. The license shall be renewed within the
thirty (30) days before expiration upon payment of fifty dollars ($50.00) and
shall be issued for the fiscal year starting July 1. No plumbing and/or gas
contractor shall do business in the city until he first obtains the license and
meets the state licensing requirements and all bonding requirements.
   B.   Contractor Responsibilities: Each contractor will be assessed an
additional fee of ten dollars ($10.00) annually for each journeyman and
apprentice employed by the contractor and performing work within the corporate
limits of the city. The contractor will be required to provide the name and
state license number of each journeyman and/or apprentice so employed. The
contractor will be responsible to notify the community services office of any
changes in licensed employees within ten (10) days. (Ord. 1182, 9-8-2015)
CHAPTER 3
FUEL GAS CODE
SECTION:
5-3-1: Fuel Gas Code Adopted; Revisions
5-3-1: FUEL GAS CODE ADOPTED; REVISIONS:
   A.   That a certain document, two (2) copies of which are on file in the
office of the City Clerk of the City of Seminole, being marked and designated
as the International Fuel Gas Code, 2021 Edition, including all Appendix
Chapters, as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby
adopted as the Fuel Gas Code of the City of Seminole, in the State of Oklahoma
for regulating and governing fuel gas systems and gas-fired appliances as
herein provided; providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees
therefor; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties,
conditions and terms of said Fuel Gas Code on file in the office of the City of
Seminole are hereby referred to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if fully
set out in this legislation, with the additions, insertions, deletions and
changes, if any, prescribed in subsection B. of this chapter.
   B.   The following sections are hereby revised:
   Section 101.1 City of Seminole.
   Section 106.6.2 Omit schedule.
   Section 106.6.3 Remove.
   Section 108.4 change to Section 115.4.
   Section 108.5 change to Section 115.4.
   Section 109, Means of Appeal: Omit entire section and replace with Section
113. (Ord. 1183, 9-8-2015; amd. Ord. 1281, 11-8-2022)
CHAPTER 4
MECHANICAL CODE
SECTION:
5-4-1: Mechanical Code Adopted; Revisions
5-4-2: Compliance With Code
5-4-3: Licensing Requirements
5-4-4: Illegal Work, Revocation Of City License
5-4-5: Permit And Fees
5-4-6: Gas Piping
5-4-7: Penalty
5-4-1: MECHANICAL CODE ADOPTED; REVISIONS:
   A.   That a certain document, two (2) copies of which are on file in the
office of the City Clerk of the City of Seminole, being marked and designated
as the International Mechanical Code, 2021 edition, including all Appendix
Chapters, as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby
adopted as the Mechanical Code of the City of Seminole, in the State of
Oklahoma regulating and governing the design, construction, quality of
materials, erection, installation, alteration, repair, location, relocation,
replacement, addition to, use or maintenance of mechanical systems as herein
provided; providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees
therefor; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties,
conditions and terms of said Mechanical Code on file with the office of the
City of Seminole are hereby referred to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if
fully set out in this legislation, with the addition, insertions, deletions and
changes, if any, prescribed in subsection B. of this section.
   B.   The following sections are hereby revised:
   Section 101.1. Insert: City of Seminole.
   Section 106.5.2. Remove.
   Section 106.5.3. Remove.
   Section 108.4. change to Section 115.4.
   Section 108.5 Omit entire section and replace with Section 114.
   Section 202 Insert the following definitions:
      BOARD: The Oklahoma construction industries board.
      CITY: The city of Seminole.
      COMMITTEE: The committee of mechanical examiners.
      DEPARTMENT: The Oklahoma construction industries board.
      GAS PIPING: Means and includes all natural gas piping to the nearest
connection within or adjacent to any building, structure, or conveyance on the
premises.
      MECHANICAL APPRENTICE OR APPRENTICE: Any person sixteen (16) years of age
or older whose principal occupation is learning mechanical work on the job
under the direct supervision of a journey tractor.
      MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR OR CONTRACTOR: Any person engaged in the business
of planning, contracting, supervising or furnishing labor or labor and
materials for mechanical work.
      MECHANICAL FIRM: Any corporation, partnership, association,
proprietorship or other business entity which plans or engages, or offers to
engage, in mechanical work for another within this state.
      MECHANICAL JOURNEYMAN OR JOURNEYMAN: Any person other than a contractor
or apprentice who engages in mechanical work.
      MECHANICAL WORK: The installation, maintenance, repair, or renovation, in
whole or in part, of any heating system, cooling system, mechanical
refrigeration system or ventilation system or any equipment or material
including process piping used in the installation, maintenance, repair, or
renovation of such systems; provided that minor repairs are excluded.
(Ord. 1184, 9-8-2015; amd. Ord. 1278, 11-8-2022)
5-4-2: COMPLIANCE WITH CODE:
   No person, on behalf of himself or of a mechanical firm, shall engage or
offer to engage in, by advertisement or otherwise, any mechanical work as a
journeyman or contractor who does not possess a valid and appropriate license
from the Oklahoma state department of health and the city. No business entity
shall act as a mechanical firm unless a contractor is associated with and
responsible for complying with the provisions of this chapter and all
mechanical work of such entity. (Ord. 1184, 9-8-2015)
5-4-3: LICENSING REQUIREMENTS:
   For contractors, journeymen and apprentices:
   A.   State License, Bond And Insurance: Any person, firm or corporation
operating as a mechanical contractor, mechanical journeyman or mechanical
apprentice in a mechanical firm shall make application, take examinations,
provide bond, liability insurance and be licensed through the state as outlined
in the mechanical licensing act, dated November 1, 1987, or current law.
   B.   City Requirements:
      1.   A city license to operate within the corporate limits of the city
will be issued to mechanical contractors upon verification of a state
mechanical contractor's license. The city license fee for mechanical
contractors shall be the sum of two hundred dollars ($200.00) for the first
year's license. The annual renewal fee thereafter shall be the sum of fifty
dollars ($50.00). Such licenses shall be issued at the community services
office, and shall expire on June 30. Such licenses shall be renewed within the
thirty (30) days before the expiration of the then current license.
      2.   Each contractor will be assessed an additional fee of ten dollars
($10.00) annually for each journeyman and apprentice employed by the contractor
and performing work within the corporate limits of the city. The contractor
will be required to provide the name and state license number of each
journeyman and/or apprentice so employed. The contractor will be responsible to
notify the community services office of any changes in licensed employees
within ten (10) days.
      3.   No licenses required by this chapter may be assigned or transferred
to another. (Ord. 1184, 9-8-2015)
5-4-4: ILLEGAL WORK, REVOCATION OF CITY LICENSE:
   A.   Notice To Rectify Nonconformances: Any person, firm or corporation
engaged in the mechanical business whose work does not conform to the rules and
regulations hereinafter set out, or whose workmanship or materials are of
inferior quality, shall, upon notice from the mechanical official, make
necessary changes or corrections at once so as to conform to the mechanical
code. If work has not been so changed after ten (10) days' notice from the
mechanical official, the mechanical official shall then refuse to issue any
more permits until such work has fully complied with the rules and regulations
of the mechanical code.
   B.   Revocation Of License: The mechanical official shall have the authority
to revoke any license for continuous violations of this title or for good cause
shown. When the revocation of any such license is to be considered, the person,
firm, company, association, or corporation to whom the license has been issued
shall have at least three (3) days' notice in writing of the time and place of
a revocation hearing, together with a statement of the grounds upon which it is
proposed to revoke such license.
   C.   File Complaint With State Hearing Board: The mechanical official may
file a written complaint with the state mechanical hearing board for a hearing
to revoke a mechanical firm's state mechanical license. When the revocation of
any such license is to be considered at any meeting, the person, firm, company,
association or corporation to whom the license has been issued shall have at
least three (3) days' notice in writing of the time and place of such meeting,
together with a statement of the grounds upon which it is proposed to revoke
such license. (Ord. 1184, 9-8-2015)
5-4-5: PERMIT AND FEES:
   A.   Permit Required; Payment Of Fee: Before any work is commenced on any
job which is governed by the provisions of this chapter, a permit shall be
obtained from the community services office. The fees for such permits shall be
as set by the city council from time to time by motion or resolution. A copy of
the current fee schedule shall be kept in the office of the city clerk.
   B.   Exception To Permit Requirement: A permit shall not be required for the
installation, alteration or repairing of self- contained unit systems in
residential or commercial occupancies which are the type designed to be plugged
into receptacle outlets. No permit fees are required for window air
conditioners.
   C.   Purchase Of Permit Restricted: Only a licensed air conditioning,
heating or refrigeration contractor or his authorized personnel of the company
shall purchase a permit.
   D.   Minor Repairs: Neither a permit nor license shall be required for a
person who is the property owner of record, or his authorized representative,
when performing minor repair, which shall include, but not be limited to,
cleaning, adjusting, calibrating, replacement of fuses and room thermostats and
other repairs which shall not include any repair which could violate the safe
operation of the equipment.
   E.   Public Utilities: A permit and license shall be required from public
utilities, public service corporations, rural electric associations, or
municipal utilities and their subsidiaries for major repair and new
installations. Neither a permit nor license shall be required during the
performance of energy audits, operational inspections, minor maintenance or
minor repairs for their customers. (Ord. 1184, 9-8-2015)
5-4-6: GAS PIPING:
   No person shall install, replace or repair gas piping unless such person is
licensed to do gas piping under the mechanical licensing act or is licensed as
a plumbing contractor or journeyman plumber pursuant to the laws of this state.
(Ord. 1184, 9-8-2015)
5-4-7: PENALTY:
   Any person, firm or corporation or agent who shall violate a provision of
the mechanical code or fail to comply therewith or with any of the provisions
thereof, or violate a detailed statement or plans submitted and approved
thereunder, shall be guilty of a separate offense for each day or portion
thereof during which any violation of any of the provisions of the mechanical
code is committed or continued, and, upon conviction thereof, in the municipal
court for any such violation, such person shall be punished as provided in
section 1-1-8 of this code. (Ord. 1184, 9-8-2015)
CHAPTER 5
ELECTRICAL CODE AND REGULATIONS
ARTICLE A. ELECTRICAL REGULATIONS
SECTION:
5-5A-1: Electrical Code Adopted
5-5A-2: Electric Wiring Defined
5-5A-3: Inside Wiring
5-5A-4: Violation; Penalty
5-5A-1: ELECTRICAL CODE ADOPTED:
That a certain document, two (2) copies of which are on file in the office of
the City Clerk of the City of Seminole, being marked and designated as the NFPA
70 National Electrical Code, 2020 edition including all Appendix Chapters, as
published by the National Fire Protection Agency, be and is hereby adopted as
the Electrical Code of the City of Seminole, in the State of Oklahoma,
regulating and governing the safeguarding of life and property; providing for
the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor; and each and all of
the regulations, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said Fire Code
on file in the office of the City Clerk are hereby referred to, adopted and
made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this legislation, with the
additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in Section
5-5A-2 of this section. (Ord. 1188, 9-8-2015; amd. Ord. 1279, 11-8-2022)
5-5A-2: ELECTRIC WIRING DEFINED:
"Electric wiring", as used in this chapter means the installation of electrical
conductors or apparatus of any nature to be connected to light, heat or power
service, except lines and regulation of electricity, and remaining the property
of the service company. (Ord. 1188, 9-8-2015)
5-5A-3: INSIDE WIRING:
All electrical wiring hereafter installed in all buildings shall be installed
according to the currently adopted NEC regulations, and contain a main switch
of proper size, not smaller than two hundred (200) ampere capacity. (Ord. 1188,
9-8-2015; amd. Ord. 1228, 2-12-2019)
5-5A-4: VIOLATION; PENALTY:
Any person who violates any provision of this chapter either by doing that
which is prohibited or by failing or refusing to do that which is commanded, is
guilty of an offense and, upon conviction thereof, shall be punished as
provided in section 1-1-8 of this code. (Ord. 1188, 9-8-2015)
ARTICLE B. PERMITS AND INSPECTIONS 1
SECTION:
5-5B-1: Electrical Inspector
5-5B-2: Electric Wiring Permit
5-5B-3: Permit And Inspection Fees
5-5B-4: Temporary Permits, Refusal
5-5B-5: Wiring Inspection
5-5B-6: Unsafe Or Defective Wiring
5-5B-7: Wiring Changes; Notice Required
 
Notes
1 1. See section 5-5A-4 of this chapter for penalty provisions.
5-5B-1: ELECTRICAL INSPECTOR:
   The electrical inspector shall be appointed by the city manager. His duties
shall include enforcement of the electrical code and regulations. (Ord. 1188,
9-8-2015)
5-5B-2: ELECTRIC WIRING PERMIT:
   A.   Permit Required: No person, firm or corporation shall do, or cause to
be done, any interior or exterior electrical wiring, or any electrical
construction, electrical installation or alteration of any electrical wiring,
apparatus or fixtures within the city without first having obtained an
electrical construction permit number for the work from the community services
office. A permit for such work shall not be issued to any person, firm or
corporation that has failed to comply with the provisions of the ordinances of
the city. Permits to do electrical work shall be issued only to licensed
electrical contractors. Permits shall not be required for maintenance work or
for repair work if the maintenance and repair work do not require alteration or
rearrangement of electrical installation. Permits shall not be required for
electric wiring or alterations in existing wiring to central stations, power
houses and substations belonging to the electric service company operating
under a franchise.
   B.   Application For Permit: Applicants for permits, as required herein,
shall, prior to doing any work requiring a permit, call the community services
office of the city, and give the name of the electrical contractor who is to do
such work and the address where the work is to be done.
   C.   Failure To Obtain Permit:
      1.   Double Fee: Any electrical contractor who proceeds to do work herein
described requiring a permit without following the provisions of this section
shall be assessed double the amount of the fee which should have been paid,
which sum shall be deducted from his bond if not otherwise paid.
      2.   Cessation Of Work: If the electrical inspector of the city or any of
his assistants finds electrical work in progress on any job for which no
electrical construction permit has been issued, he shall immediately order all
such electrical work to cease, and any person who thereafter does electrical
work on such job before an electrical construction permit has been issued
therefor shall be guilty of an offense. (Ord. 1188, 9-8-2015)
5-5B-3: PERMIT AND INSPECTION FEES:
   Before any work is commenced on any job which is governed by the provisions
of this chapter, a permit shall be obtained from the community services office.
The fees for such permits shall be as set by the city council from time to time
by motion or resolution. A copy of the current fee schedule shall be kept in
the office of the city clerk. (Ord. 1188, 9-8-2015)
5-5B-4: TEMPORARY PERMITS, REFUSAL:
   When for good and sufficient reasons at the discretion of the city
electrical inspector, it appears necessary, and he may issue permits for
connection to unfinished or defective wiring for a period of time not to exceed
thirty (30) days; otherwise, no electric light or power company shall connect
to any installation of any kind whatsoever until furnished with the certificate
of inspection from the electrical inspector; provided further, that the
electric light or power companies shall, upon written notice from the
electrical inspector, disconnect from any service designated by the notice from
the city electrical inspector stating any defects or faults, until the defects
or faults have been corrected. (Ord. 1188, 9-8-2015)
5-5B-5: WIRING INSPECTION:
   A.   Permittee Notify Inspector: It shall be the responsibility of the
person obtaining the permit for each respective job to notify the electrical
inspector upon the completion of the temporary pole or services, temporary,
final or "roughing in" work for inspection as well as the completed job for
final inspection. The electrical inspector, having received such notice, must
inspect, or cause to be inspected by a qualified representative, any electric
wiring within the city.
   B.   Notice By Inspector To Permittee: After inspecting the electrical
wiring of any building, the inspector shall leave notice in the form of a tag
or label attached to the service entrance switch. This notice shall clearly
state whether the wiring is approved or is to be kept open for corrections, and
no person shall seal or conceal any electrical wiring until such wiring has
been approved. If in any case the wiring is in such a position as to interfere
with the completion of the building as called for in the plans, the wiring
contractor must be notified to have it changed. (Ord. 1188, 9-8-2015)
5-5B-6: UNSAFE OR DEFECTIVE WIRING:
   The electrical inspector shall have the authority to make special rulings,
when circumstances warrant, for the safeguarding of life and property and
improvement of electrical installations. Whenever any electrical wiring or
equipment is found by the electrical inspector to be unsafe or defective, he
shall notify the owner or person in control thereof to repair or remove the
same; and upon the owner's failure to comply within such time as the electrical
inspector shall specify, the inspector shall cause service to be discontinued.
(Ord. 1188, 9-8-2015)
5-5B-7: WIRING CHANGES; NOTICE REQUIRED:
   When any alterations or changes are made in the wiring of any building or
any new wires are installed, it shall be the responsibility of the person,
partnership or corporation doing or having such work done to first obtain a
permit from the building department and to notify the inspector in writing
immediately after the completion of the work. The inspector shall then inspect
the work as herein provided. (Ord. 1188, 9-8-2015)
ARTICLE C. LICENSING 1
SECTION:
5-5C-1: License Required
5-5C-2: License And Fee
5-5C-3: Exemption To Licensing Requirements
5-5C-4: Illegal Work; Revocation Of License
 
Notes
1 1. See section 5-5A-4 of this chapter for penalty provisions.
5-5C-1: LICENSE REQUIRED:
   All persons, firms, partnerships, corporations, or individuals engaged or
hereafter engaging in the business of installing electric wiring or lighting
fixtures of any nature, in or on any building within the corporate limits of
the city, shall procure from the building official a license, which license
obtained and so long as in force, shall entitle the holder thereof to install
electric wiring for the transmission of electric energy for light, heat, or
power. (Ord. 1188, 9-8-2015)
5-5C-2: LICENSE AND FEE:
   A.   Contractors: The annual fee for such contractor license to each person,
firm, or corporation shall be in the amount of two hundred dollars ($200.00)
for the first year upon satisfying the governing authority as to his competency
to enter the electrical contracting business. The annual fee for subsequent
years shall be in the sum of fifty dollars ($50.00) and shall be issued for a
fiscal year starting July 1. A public service corporation operating under a
regular franchise shall be exempt from the requirements of this section insofar
as the same affects property owned or controlled by them. No electrical
contractor shall do business in the city until he first obtains the appropriate
state license and meets state licensing and bond requirements.
   B.   Journeymen And Apprentices: Each contractor will be assessed an
additional fee of ten dollars ($10.00) annually for each journeyman and
apprentice employed by the contractor and performing work within the corporate
limits of the city. The contractor will be required to provide the name and
state license number of each journeyman and/or apprentice so employed. The
contractor will be responsible to notify the community services office of any
changes in licensed employees within ten (10) days. (Ord. 1188, 9-8-2015)
5-5C-3: EXEMPTION TO LICENSING REQUIREMENTS:
A public utility electric service corporation, operating under a regular
franchise, shall be exempted from the requirements of obtaining a license or
registering, insofar as the same affects property owned or controlled by it.
(Ord. 1188, 9-8-2015)
5-5C-4: ILLEGAL WORK; REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
   Any person, firm or corporation engaged in the electrical business whose
work does not conform to the rules and regulations herein set out, or whose
workmanship or materials are of inferior quality, shall, on notice from the
electrical official, make necessary changes or corrections at once so as to
conform to the electrical code. If work has not been so changed after ten (10)
days' notice from the electrical official, the electrical official shall then
refuse to issue any more permits until such work has fully complied with the
rules and regulations of the electrical code. The electrical official may
appear before the governing authority and request that all licenses be revoked
because of continuous violations. When the revocation of any such license is to
be considered at any meeting, the person, firm, company, association or
corporation to whom the license has been issued shall have at least three (3)
days' notice in writing of the time and place of such meeting, together with a
statement of the grounds upon which it is proposed to revoke such license.
(Ord. 1188, 9-8-2015)
CHAPTER 6
RESIDENTIAL CODE
SECTION:
5-6-1: Residential Code Adopted; Revisions
5-6-2: Residential Building Permits
5-6-3: Residential Contractors
5-6-4: Exemptions
5-6-5: Violation; Penalty
5-6-6: Roofing Contractors
5-6-1: RESIDENTIAL CODE ADOPTED; REVISIONS:
   A.   That a certain document, two (2) copies of which are on file in the
office of the City Clerk of the City of Seminole, being marked and designated
as the International Residential Code, 2021 edition, including all Appendix
Chapters (see International Residential Code Section R102.5, 2021 edition), as
published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the
Residential Code of the City of Seminole, in the State of Oklahoma for
regulating and governing the construction, alteration, movement, enlargement,
replacement, repair, equipment, location, removal and demolition of detached
one- and two-family dwellings and multiple single-family dwellings (townhouses)
not more than threes stories in height with separate means of egress as herein
provided; providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees
therefor; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties,
conditions and terms of said Residential Code on file with the office of the
City of Seminole are hereby referred to, adopted, and made a part hereof, as if
fully set out in this ordinance, with the addition, insertions, deletions and
changes, if any, prescribed in division B. of this section.
   B.   The following sections are hereby revised:
   Section R101.1. Insert: City of Seminole.
   Section P2603.5.1 Insert: 18 inches for sewer line depth in two places.
   Section R905.7, Wood Shingles. The installation of wood shingles in new
construction is prohibited unless the distance to adjacent structures is a
minimum of 30 feet. The installation of wood shingles shall comply with the
provisions of this section and table R905.7.4.
   Section R905.8, Wood Shakes. The installation of wood shakes in new
construction is prohibited unless the distance to adjacent structures is a
minimum of 30 feet. The installation of wood shakes shall comply with the
provisions of this section and table R905.8.5.
   Section R908, Reroofing, is amended by adding the following sections:
   Section R908.1.3: Wood shingles and shakes shall not be permitted as roof
coverings on structures within the City. Existing wood shingle roofs may be
repaired using wood shingles when the area to be repaired is less than 25
percent of the existing total roof area. Wood shingles are allowed then there
is a 30-foot distance from adjacent structures.
   Section R908.1.4: Permit Requirements: The building official shall issue
permits for the replacement and recovering of all roofs for structures located
within City limits. (Ord. 1185, 9-8-2015; amd. Ord. 1275, 11-8-2022)
5-6-2: RESIDENTIAL BUILDING PERMITS:
   A.   Permits: A residential building permit shall be issued only to a
residential contractor licensed as required in this chapter or to the owner or
lessee of the residential structure, if said owner or lessee is personally
completing the work.
   B.   Definition: For the purposes of this provision, a "residential building
permit" shall refer to any permit for new construction, renovation,
reconstruction or addition to any one- or two-family structure, including
attached garages. Specifically excluded are carports, patio covers, storage
buildings, accessory buildings, pools and fences. Nothing contained within this
chapter shall serve to supersede or lessen the application of any provisions
related to residential construction set forth within the City's adopted
Building Codes. (Ord. 1114, 4-13-2010, eff. 4-13-2010)
5-6-3: RESIDENTIAL CONTRACTORS:
   A.   License Required: Residential contractors shall be licensed with the
Office of Community Services before obtaining a residential building permit as
required by this chapter. License shall be subject to the approval of the
Director of Community Services and license shall not be issued until the
contractor has provided proof of general liability insurance coverage in the
amount required by the Oklahoma Construction Industries Board for licensed
contractors. In addition contractors must provide proof of workers'
compensation insurance coverage or exemption thereof.
   B.   License Term And Fee: Licenses shall be valid for up to one year and
shall expire on April 30 of each year. The annual fee for residential
contractors shall be twenty five dollars ($25.00). Fees shall not be prorated
for licenses issued throughout the year.
   C.   License Suspension Or Revocation: The Director of Community Services
and/or the building inspector shall have the authority to suspend or revoke any
license for continuous violations of this title or for good cause shown. When
the revocation of any such license is to be considered, the contractor shall
have at least three (3) days' notice in writing of the time and place of a
revocation hearing, together with a statement of the grounds upon which it is
proposed to revoke such license. (Ord. 1114, 4-13-2010, eff. 4-13-2010)
5-6-4: EXEMPTIONS:
   Nothing in this chapter shall prohibit a property owner or lessee from
performing work on his own property, nor shall this chapter require a property
owner performing work on his own property to obtain a residential contractor's
license. This provision shall not be construed to allow the owner or lessee to
forego the requirements of obtaining a lawful permit or to hire unlicensed
persons to perform work as required in this title. (Ord. 1114, 4-13-2010, eff.
4-13-2010)
5-6-5: VIOLATION; PENALTY:
   Any person found violating any provision of this chapter or the codes
adopted shall, upon conviction, be punished as provided in section 1-1-8 of
this Code. (Ord. 1114, 4-13-2010, eff. 4-13-2010)
5-6-6: ROOFING CONTRACTORS:
   A.   License Required, Residential: Roofing contractors shall be licensed
with the Office of Community Development before obtaining a permit as required
by this section. Before a license is issued, contractor shall possess a current
and valid registration and endorsement (unless exempt) by the Roofing
Contractor Registration Act 1  and be in compliance with the Rules of the
Oklahoma Construction Industries Board (title 158 chapter 85).
   B.   License Required, Commercial: A commercial license shall be issued upon
verification of a current and valid registration as required by the Roofing
Contractor Registration Act 2  and a commercial roofing endorsement through the
Oklahoma Construction Industries Board, unless exempt by said board
regulations. A commercial license shall be valid for residential and commercial
roof construction and replacement.
   C.   License Term And Fee: Licenses shall be valid for up to one year and
shall expire on April 30 of each year. The annual fee is as follows:
 
Residential roofing contractor $25.00 per year
Commercial roofing contractor  50.00 per year
 
   Fees shall not be prorated for licenses issued throughout the year.
   D.   License Suspension Or Revocation: The Director of Community Development
and/or the building inspector shall have the authority to suspend or revoke any
license for continuous violations of this title or for good cause shown. When
the revocation of any such license is to be considered, the contractor shall
have at least three (3) days' notice in writing of the time and place of a
revocation hearing, together with a statement of the grounds upon which it is
proposed to revoke such license.
   E.   Permits: A roofing permit shall be issued only to a licensed roofing
contractor as required in this section, or, to the owner or lessee of a
residential structure, if said owner or lessee is personally completing the
work. Any owner or lessee personally engaged in such work shall provide written
verification to the Office of Community Development prior to obtaining a
permit.
   F.   Violation; Penalty: Any person found violating this section shall, upon
conviction, be punished in accordance with sections 1-1-8 and
1-1-9 of this Code. (Ord. 1208, 2-13-2018)
 
Notes
1 1. 59 OS § 1151 et seq.
2 2. 59 OS § 1151 et seq.
CHAPTER 7
LIFE SAFETY AND FIRE CODES 1
SECTION:
5-7-1: Codes Adopted
5-7-2: Fire Code Revisions
5-7-3: Geographic Limits
 
Notes
1 1. See section 5-1-3 of this title for penalty provisions; see also title 13,
  chapter 4 of this code for fire prevention regulations.
5-7-1: CODES ADOPTED:
That a certain document, two copies of which are on file in the office of the
City Clerk of the City of Seminole, being marked and designated as the
International Fire Code, 2021 edition, and the NFPA 101 Life Safety Code, 2021
edition including all Appendix Chapters (see International Fire Code Section
101.2.1, 2021 edition), as published by the International Code Council, be and
is hereby adopted as the Fire Code of the City of Seminole, in the State of
Oklahoma, regulating and governing the safeguarding of life and property from
fire and explosion hazards arising from the storage, handling and use of
hazardous substance4s, materials and devices, and from conditions hazardous to
life or property in the occupancy of buildings and premises as herein provided;
providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees therefor; and each
and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said
Fire Code on file in the office of the City Clerk are hereby referred to,
adopted and made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this legislation, with
the additions, insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in Section
5-7-2 of this chapter. (Ord. 1187, 9-8-2015; amd. Ord. 1282, 11-8-2022)
5-7-2: FIRE CODE REVISIONS:
That the following sections are hereby revised:
   Section 101.1 Insert City of Seminole.
   Section 109.47 change to Section 112.4.
   Section 111.4 change to Section 112.4 and remove $100.00.
(Ord. 1187, 9-8-2015; amd. Ord. 1282, 11-8-2022)
5-7-3: GEOGRAPHIC LIMITS:
That the geographic limits referred to in certain sections of the 2021
International Fire Code are hereby established as follows:
   Section 5704.2.9.6.1 (geographic limits in which the storage of Class I and
Class II liquids in above-ground tanks outside of buildings is prohibited).
   Section 5706.2.4.4 (geographic limits in which the storage of Class I and
Class H liquids in above-ground tanks is prohibited).
   Section 5806.2 (geographic limits in which the storage of flammable
cryogenic fluids in stationary containers is prohibited).
   Section 6104.2 (geographic limits in which the storage of liquefied
petroleum gas is restricted for the protection of heavily populated or
congested areas). (Ord. 1187, 9-8-2015; amd. Ord. 1282, 11-8-2022)
CHAPTER 8
PROPERTY MAINTENANCE CODE
SECTION:
5-8-1: Property Maintenance Code Adopted; Revisions
5-8-1: PROPERTY MAINTENANCE CODE ADOPTED; REVISIONS:
   A.   That a certain document, two (2) copies of which are on file in the
office of the City Clerk of the City of Seminole, being marked and designated
as the International Property Maintenance Code, 2021 edition, as published by
the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the Property
Maintenance Code of the City of Seminole, in the State of Oklahoma for
regulating and governing the conditions essential to ensure that structures are
safe, sanitary and fit for occupation and use; and the condemnation of
buildings and structures unfit for human occupancy and use, and the demolition
of such existing structures as herein provided; providing for the issuance of
permits and collection of fees therefor; and each and all of the regulations,
provisions, penalties, conditions and terms of said Residential Code on file
with the office of the City of Seminole are hereby referred to, adopted, and
made a part hereof, as if fully set out in this ordinance, with the addition,
insertions, deletions and changes, if any, prescribed in subsection B. of this
section.
   B.   The following sections are hereby revised:
   Section 101.1. Insert: City of Seminole.
   Section 103.5. Insert: Delete section.
   Section 111 Means of Appeal: Omit entire section and replace with Section
107.
   Section 302.4. Weeds - insert 'twelve (12) inches'.
   Section 304.14. Insect screens - insert 'January l' and 'December 31'.
   Section 602.3. Heating Facilities - insert 'January 1' and 'December 31'.
   Section 602.4. Occupiable Work Spaces - insert 'January 1' and 'December
31'.
(Ord. 1186, 9-8-2015; amd. Ord. 1277, 11-8-2022)
CHAPTER 9
OIL AND GAS DRILLING
SECTION:
5-9-1: Definitions
5-9-2: Drilling Permits Required
5-9-3: Bond And Insurance
5-9-4: Casing
5-9-5: Earthen Retaining Wall
5-9-6: Earthen Slush Pits
5-9-7: Premises Maintained
5-9-8: Reserve Pits And Mud Circulation In Sportsman's Lake Area
5-9-9: Safety Devices And Practices
5-9-10: Storage Tanks
5-9-11: Tubing
5-9-12: Fees
5-9-13: Penalty; Nuisance Declared
5-9-1: DEFINITIONS:
   The following words and phrases when used in this chapter shall, for the
purposes of this chapter, have the meanings respectively ascribed to them in
this section, except where the context otherwise requires:
   CIRCULATING MUD PIT: The working pit from which drilling muds are
continually recirculated during the drilling process into and from the drilling
hole for the purpose of flushing therefrom the drill bit cuttings and as a
lubricant to reduce torque, drag, heat, friction, and differential sticking
during the drilling process.
   DISPOSAL WELL: Any well drilled or actually used for injection of salt water
or other substances into the earth at a point other or different than the point
of extraction or production thereof from the earth.
   MUD: The drilling fluid used and recirculated through the drilling hole as a
lubricant to reduce torque, drag, heat, friction, and differential sticking and
to flush drill bit cuttings from the hole during the drilling process.
   MUD PROGRAM: The planning usage of drilling fluid lubricants, specifying
with particularity the type, name and physical and chemical composition and the
characteristics of all ingredients thereof, together with such laboratory and
other technical data as may be necessary or required by the community services
office to evaluate the same as pollutive, deleterious or otherwise.
   OIL OR GAS WELL: Any well drilled, operated or maintained for the production
of oil, gas, casing head gas, or any of them, or their byproducts or
derivatives. Included in this term are water wells drilled for the purpose of
providing a source or a location for the injection of water, either fresh water
or salt water, into the ground to stimulate the production of oil, gas, casing
head gas, or any of them or their byproducts or derivatives.
   RESERVE PIT: Any excavation, pit, or receptacle designed or actually used to
receive, store, or hold rocks, drill bit cuttings, shale, sand, fresh water, or
drilling mud that contains no salt water, oil, oil derivatives, caustics,
acids, or other deleterious substances harmful to soil, vegetation, or
injurious to animal or human life.
   SLUSH PIT: Any excavation, pit, or receptacle designed or actually used to
receive, store, or hold waste oil, oil derivatives, sand, salt water, or other
waste products, or deleterious substances produced or used in the drilling,
swabbing, cleaning, or reworking of any oil, gas, or disposal well.
   SPORTSMAN'S LAKE AREA: Means and includes that land encompassed by the
following legal description:
S/2 NE/4; NE/4 NE/4; NW/4 NE/4 of section 28-T9N-R7E;
N/2 and the SE/4 and the N/2 of NW/4 of SW/4 and E/2 of SW/4 of section 34-T9N-
R7E;
N/2 of NE/4 and E/2 of SE/4 of NE/4 and E/2 of W/2 of SE/4 of NE/4 of section
33-T9N-R7E;
W/2 of NW/4; and NW/4 SW/4; and starting at the Southeast corner of the SW/4,
thence West 50' to the point of beginning, thence North 686.8', thence North
49o00' West a distance of 810.9', thence North 1421.2', thence West 660',
thence South 1320', thence West 1320', thence South 1320', thence East 2590',
to the point of beginning; all in section 35-T9N-R7E;
   Lot 3 and Lot 1 of section 3-T8N-R7E;
N/2 of N/2 of SW/4 of NW/4; and Lot 4 less and except a tract or parcel
described as follows: beginning at the NE corner of said Lot 4, thence South a
distance of 547.6' to the point of beginning, thence North 87o22', West a
distance of 281.7', thence South 30o38' West a distance of 146.9'; thence South
4o22' West a distance of 276', thence South 61o24' East a distance of 429.8',
thence North 596.4' to the point of beginning; and the North 20 acres of Lot 3;
and the S/2 N/2 SW/4 of NW/4; all in section 2-T8N-R7E;
   NW/4 of SE/4; and beginning at the NW corner, thence South 00o2' East a
distance of 1320' to the point of beginning, thence East a distance of 660',
thence South 660', thence East 541.5', thence South 45o00' East a distance of
993.5', thence West a distance of 1861.5', thence North 00o02' West a distance
of 1320' to the point of beginning; and the NE/4 SE/4; and the SW/4 SE/4; and
the SE/4 SE/4; and SW/4; all in section 27-T9N-R7E;
   Lot 2 and N/2 NW/4 SE/4 NE/4 and NE/4 SE/4 NE/4 and N/2 SE/4 SE/4 NE/4 of
section 3-T8N-R7E;
   NW/4 SW/4; and SW/4 SW/4 of section 26-T9N-R7E;
   SE/4 of section 28-T9N-R7E, all in Seminole County, Oklahoma.
(Ord. 1152, 11-13-2012)
5-9-2: DRILLING PERMITS REQUIRED:
   A.   Permit Required: No person, firm or corporation shall drill an oil,
gas, or disposal well, or otherwise mine or produce other minerals without
having previously obtained a permit to do same from the community services
office.
   B.   Application For Permit: All applicants desiring a permit to drill an
oil, gas, or disposal well shall submit to the community services office before
receiving a permit:
      1.   A description of the location of the well, specifying and
identifying the well location within a particular ten (10) acre tract within a
specific quarter, section, township, and range;
      2.   A list of all equipment that will be utilized in the drilling; and
      3.   The mud program to be utilized on that particular well.
   C.   Sportsman's Lake Area: No drilling permits shall be issued for any oil
or gas well in the Sportsman's Lake area. Drilling of any oil or gas well in
the Sportsman's Lake area is prohibited. Any ordinance or portion thereof that
is inconsistent with this subsection prohibiting drilling is hereby repealed.
All ordinances or portions thereof that are not inconsistent with this
subsection prohibiting drilling shall continue as valid and in force and
effect. (Ord. 1112, 3-9-2010, eff. 3-9-2010)
5-9-3: BOND AND INSURANCE:
   A.   Cash Deposit: Prior to the issuance of any permit, the applicant shall
deposit with the city clerk a cash amount of ten thousand dollars ($10,000.00)
as a security for the compliance with all requirements of this chapter by the
owner, his driller, agents, and employees during the drilling operation.
   B.   Refund Of Deposit; Bond Required: When the drilling operation has been
completed in compliance with all requirements of this chapter, the ten thousand
dollar ($10,000.00) cash amount shall be refunded upon the deposit with the
city clerk of a surety bond in the amount of ten thousand dollars ($10,000.00)
conditioned upon plugging of the well and/or the restoration of the land's
surface, such plugging and restoration to be performed within ninety (90) days
of the abandonment, in accordance with the rules and regulations of the
Oklahoma corporation commission and this code.
   C.   Forfeiture Of Surety Bond: Upon noncompliance of the above listed
conditions, the cash amount of the surety bond shall be forfeited, and shall
provide reimbursement to the landowner for the restoration of the land's
surface.
   D.   Insurance Requirement: Prior to the issuance of any permit, the
applicant shall also deposit a copy of an insurance policy, of a corporate
insurer licensed to do business in the state of Oklahoma, in an amount not less
than one million dollars ($1,000,000.00). The policy shall:
      1.   Contain no exclusion from coverage of contamination or pollution of
surface or subterranean streams, watercourses, lakes, or public or private
water supplies; and
      2.   Be conditioned for payment of all damages due to injury to persons,
or damage to property resulting from the drilling, operation, or maintenance of
the proposed well, or any structure, machinery, equipment, pipelines, or
appurtenances used in connection therewith. (2000 Code § 5-702; amd. Ord. 1057,
11-13-2007, eff. 11-13-2007)
5-9-4: CASING:
A minimum of one thousand feet (1,000') surface pipe or a minimum of one
hundred feet (100') below the base of Vamoosa sand, whichever distance is
greater, shall be set in each well after notification of intention to do so has
been given the conservation department of the Oklahoma corporation commission,
whose representative shall be entitled to inspect the installation thereof and
direct the type and amount of cement to be used in cementing the same in the
hole. (2000 Code § 5-704; amd. Ord. 1057, 11-13-2007, eff. 11-13-2007)
5-9-5: EARTHEN RETAINING WALL:
   A.   An earthen retaining wall of adequate size for the terrain shall be
constructed on the low side of all well sites on sloping or unlevel ground.
   B.   The top of the retaining wall shall be at least as high as the top of
the Christmas tree or other wellhead connections on any completed well or at
least as high as the ground at the point where surface casing is set in the
well when drilling. (2000 Code § 5-705)
5-9-6: EARTHEN SLUSH PITS:
   A.   No earthen slush pits shall be constructed, built, maintained or used
without prior approval of the community services office. However, in the
Sportsman's Lake area, no earthen slush pits shall be constructed, built,
maintained or used by any person. (2000 Code § 5-706; amd. Ord. 1057, 11-13-
2007, eff. 11-13-2007)
   B.   All waste oil, salt water, liquid with oil content, gasoline or other
oil derivatives or byproducts, sand, sludge, or other waste produced in
connection with the drilling, testing, cleaning, swabbing, reworking or
operating of any oil, gas or disposal well shall be captured and retained in
steel or fiberglass tanks or vessels and transported from the premises to a
disposal facility approved by the Oklahoma corporation commission.
   C.   No person shall permit such substances to escape from the premises
owned, leased, or controlled by the persons conducting such operations by
seepage, overflow, or otherwise, nor flow across the surface of the ground or
upon any public way, into any storm or sanitary sewer, drainage ditch, upon any
gutter or paving or into any gully, stream or tributary. (2000 Code § 5-706)
5-9-7: PREMISES MAINTAINED:
   The premises upon which any oil, gas, or disposal well is drilled, operated
or maintained shall be kept free of all accumulations of rubbish, litter,
unused equipment or materials, excess rotary mud, salt water, waste oil, or oil
byproducts and other waste, insofar as the same may be reasonably done in the
conduct of operations. (2000 Code § 5-707)
5-9-8: RESERVE PITS AND MUD CIRCULATION IN SPORTSMAN'S LAKE AREA:
   A.   Reserve pits located in the Sportsman's Lake area shall be exclusively
metal tanks or vessels.
   B.   All circulating mud pits utilized within such area shall likewise be
exclusively of metal construction. (2000 Code § 5-708)
   C.   No chemicals or substances shall be placed in said reserve or
circulating mud pits, except as indicated in the mud program approved by the
community services office at the time of issuance of the drilling permit, and
all contents of such reserve and circulating mud pits shall, during and upon
completion of the drilling of the well, be transported from the premises to a
disposal facility. (2000 Code § 5-708; amd. Ord. 1057, 11-13-2007, eff. 11-13-
2007)
5-9-9: SAFETY DEVICES AND PRACTICES:
   A.   Approved equipment, standard devices and all ordinary methods commonly
known and used in the oil and gas drilling and producing industry for the
safety and protection of property from damage due to drilling and operating
activities shall be used at all locations. Failure on the part of any owner,
driller, or operator to utilize such equipment, devices or methods shall be the
basis for objection thereof by the city or any person affected thereby, in
addition to any penalties provided in this chapter.
   B.   All drilling wells shall be equipped with a master gate or its
equivalent blowout preventers, flow lines and valves commensurate with the
working involved. (2000 Code § 5-709)
5-9-10: STORAGE TANKS:
   A.   Storage tanks or other types of tanks containing flammable or
deleterious substances used in connection with any oil, gas, or disposal well
shall have earthen embankments constructed around them of sufficient size and
height to be able to adequately contain volume of such tanks should a rupture
occur at the floor of such tank.
   B.   No drain plugs, openings or siphons shall be placed in the walls or
dikes which will permit the escape of any liquids through the same.
   C.   No such tank shall be located closer than one hundred feet (100') to a
dwelling or business structure, street or highway.
   D.   All salt water holding tanks for new installation and/or replacement
will be of fiberglass. (2000 Code § 5-710)
5-9-11: TUBING:
   A.   Upon completion of any flowing well, the wellhead equipment shall have,
on the tubing, at least one master valve plus a flow valve, and a valve on the
casing annulus.
   B.   All disposal wells shall be equipped with at least two inch (2") inside
diameter plastic lined tubing or its equivalent set on a packer and a pressure
gauge shall be installed on the casing annulus at all times. (2000 Code § 5-
711)
5-9-12: FEES:
   The following fees shall be charged by the city under this chapter:
   A.   For oil/gas well drilling permit: One thousand dollars ($1,000.00);
(2000 Code § 5-712; amd. Ord. 1057, 11-13-2007, eff. 11-13-2007)
   B.   For oil/gas well maintenance generally: Twenty five dollars ($25.00)
per inspection not to exceed one hundred dollars ($100.00) per year; and
   C.   For oil/gas well maintenance in Sportsman's Lake area: One hundred
dollars ($100.00) per year. (2000 Code § 5-712)
5-9-13: PENALTY; NUISANCE DECLARED:
   Any person, firm or corporation violating any of the provisions of this
chapter shall, upon conviction thereof, be punished as provided in section 1-1-
8 of this code. Each day any violation is committed or continues to exist shall
constitute a separate offense and be punishable as such. In addition, violation
of any of the provisions of this chapter is declared to be a public nuisance
and shall be a basis for injunction at the suit of the city or at the suit of
any person, firm or corporation adversely affected thereby. (2000 Code § 5-713)
CHAPTER 10
FAIR HOUSING
SECTION:
5-10-1: Purposes
5-10-2: Definitions
5-10-3: Housing Discrimination Acts Prohibited
5-10-4: Exemptions
5-10-5: Fair Housing Board
5-10-6: Procedure For Complaints
5-10-7: Serving Of Notices
5-10-8: Interference, Coercion Or Intimidation
5-10-9: Prevention Of Intimidation In Fair Housing Cases
5-10-10: Penalty
5-10-1: PURPOSES:
   The general purposes of this chapter are:
   A.   To secure for all people equal access to housing in all neighborhoods;
and
   B.   To preserve the public safety, health and welfare. (2000 Code § 5-802)
5-10-2: DEFINITIONS:
   For the purpose of this chapter, the following terms shall have the meanings
ascribed to them in this section:
   DISCRIMINATORY HOUSING PRACTICE: An act that is unlawful under this chapter.
   DWELLING AND HOUSING: Any building, structure or portion thereof which is
occupied as or designed or intended for occupancy as a residence by one or more
families and any vacant land which is offered for sale or lease for the
construction or location thereon of any such building, structure or portion
thereof.
   FAMILY: Includes a single individual.
   PERSON: Includes one or more individuals, corporations, partnerships,
associations, labor organizations, legal representatives, mutual companies,
joint stock companies, trusts, unincorporated organizations, trustees in
bankruptcy, receivers and fiduciaries.
   TO RENT: Includes to lease, to sublease, to let and otherwise to grant for a
consideration the right to occupy premises owned by the occupant. (2000 Code §
5-801)
5-10-3: HOUSING DISCRIMINATION ACTS PROHIBITED:
   It shall be unlawful for any person, real estate broker, real estate
salesperson, or corporation:
   A.   To refuse to sell or rent after the making of a bona fide offer or to
refuse to negotiate for the sale or rental of or otherwise make unavailable or
deny a dwelling to any person because of race, gender, color, religion,
national origin, age, handicap or familial status.
   B.   To discriminate against any person in the terms, conditions or
privileges of sale or rental of a dwelling or in the provision of services or
facilities in connection therewith because of race, gender, color, religion,
national origin, age, handicap or familial status.
   C.   To make, print or publish or cause to be made, printed or published any
notice, statement or advertisement with respect to the sale or rental of a
dwelling that indicates any preference, limitation or discrimination based on
race, gender, color, religion, national origin, age, handicap or familial
status or an intention to make any such preference, limitation or
discrimination.
   D.   To represent to any person because of race, gender, color, religion,
national origin, age, handicap or familial status that any dwelling is not
available for inspection, sale or rental when such dwelling is, in fact, so
available.
   E.   To induce or attempt to induce any person to sell or rent any dwelling,
for profit, by representations regarding the entry or prospective entry into
the neighborhood of a person or persons of particular race, gender, color,
religion, national origin, age, handicap or familial status.
   F.   It shall be unlawful for any bank, building and loan association,
insurance company or other corporation, association, firm or enterprise whose
business consists in whole or in part in the making of commercial real estate
loans to deny a loan or other financial assistance to a person applying
therefor for the purpose of purchasing, constructing, improving, repairing or
maintaining a dwelling or to discriminate against him in the fixing of the
amount, interest rate, duration or other terms or conditions of such loan or
other financial assistance because of the race, gender, color, religion,
national origin, age, handicap or familial status of such person or of any
person associated with him in connection with such loan or other financial
assistance or the purposes of such loan or other financial assistance, or of
the present or prospective owners, lessees, tenants or occupants of the
dwelling or dwellings in relation to which such loan or other financial
assistance is to be made or given, provided that nothing contained in this
section shall impair the scope or effectiveness of the exception contained in
section 5-10-4 of this chapter.
   G.   It shall be unlawful to deny any person access to or membership or
participation in any multiple listing service, rental or facility relating to
the business of selling or renting dwellings or to discriminate against him in
the terms or conditions of such access, membership or participation on account
of race, gender, color, religion, national origin, age, handicap or familial
status. (2000 Code § 5-803; amd. Ord. 1057, 11-13-2007, eff. 11-13-2007)
5-10-4: EXEMPTIONS:
   Nothing herein shall apply to any religious organization, association,
society or private club; a religious nonprofit organization, operated,
supervised or controlled by or in conjunction with a religious organization,
association, or society from limiting the sale or rental of dwelling units
owned and operated for other than a commercial purpose. (2000 Code § 5-804)
5-10-5: FAIR HOUSING BOARD:
   A.   Membership; Terms: There is hereby created a fair housing board of the
city, hereinafter referred to as "board", composed of five (5) members, to be
appointed by the mayor and city council for terms of three (3) years. However,
of the members first appointed under this chapter, two (2) shall be appointed
for a term of one year, two (2) shall be appointed for a term of two (2) years,
and one shall be appointed for a term of three (3) years. (2000 Code § 5-805)
   B.   Duties: It shall be the duty of the fair housing board to:
      1.   Initiate, receive, and investigate complaints charging unlawful
housing practices;
      2.   Seek conciliation of such complaints, hold hearings, make findings
of fact, and publish its findings of fact; and
      3.   Adopt such rules and regulations as may be necessary within the
limits of this chapter, and carry out the purposes and provisions of this
chapter. (2000 Code § 5-806)
5-10-6: PROCEDURE FOR COMPLAINTS:
   A.   Filing Of Complaint: Any person aggrieved by discriminatory practice
prohibited by this chapter may file with the fair housing board a complaint in
writing, under oath. The complaint shall be signed by the person claiming to be
aggrieved, and shall state the name and address of the person alleged to have
violated the provisions of this chapter, and shall further set forth the
particulars of the violation, and may include such other information as may be
required by the board. Complaints filed under this section must be filed within
thirty (30) days after the alleged violation, and failure to file within said
time shall be considered a waiver of the application of this chapter. The board
may issue a complaint on its own initiative, at any time it is within the
knowledge of the board that a person has violated any of the provisions of this
chapter.
   B.   Investigation Of Complaint: The board shall investigate each complaint
filed with the board, and shall attempt an adjustment of the complaint by means
of conference and conciliation. Sixty (60) days shall be allowed for the
purpose of investigation, conference and conciliation. Upon determination that
a complaint is not well founded, the board shall dismiss the complaint and
notify the complainant and respondent in writing of the dismissal. If the board
takes no action within ninety (90) days of the filing of the complaint, it
shall be considered as dismissed.
   C.   Notice To Answer Charges Of Complaint; Hearing: If conference or
conciliation does not result in compliance with this chapter, the board shall
cause to be issued and served in the name of the city a written notice,
together with a copy of the complaint, requiring the person named in the
complaint, hereinafter referred to as respondent, to answer charges of the
complaint at a hearing before the board at a time and place to be specified in
the notice.
   D.   Conducting Hearing; Procedure: At the hearing provided for in
subsection C of this section, the complaint shall be heard by the board. At the
hearing, the complainant or person aggrieved may appear in person or by
counsel, and the respondent may file a written answer to the complaint and may
appear in person or by legal counsel. The board, when conducting any hearing
pursuant to this section, may permit amendments to any complaint or answer, and
the testimony taken at the hearing shall be under oath, and shall be
transcribed at the request of either party, or at the direction of the board.
If the board finds at the hearing that the respondent has engaged in any
discriminatory practice or practices prohibited by this chapter, it shall state
its findings of fact, and shall so certify the matter to the city attorney for
appropriate action. No prosecution shall be brought under this chapter except
upon such certification. If the board, upon hearing, finds that respondent has
not engaged in any discriminatory practice, it shall state its findings of fact
and shall issue and file an order dismissing the complaint. The board shall
establish rules and regulations to govern and expedite and effectuate the
foregoing procedure, and shall maintain the files provided for herein. (2000
Code § 5-807)
5-10-7: SERVING OF NOTICES:
   Any and all notices required under the provisions of this chapter to be
served upon any person may be served personally on such person, or by mailing a
copy thereof by certified or registered mail, with return receipt requested, to
the most current business or residence address of such person. (2000 Code § 5-
808)
5-10-8: INTERFERENCE, COERCION OR INTIMIDATION:
   It shall be unlawful to coerce, intimidate, threaten or interfere with any
person in the exercise or enjoyment of or on account of his having exercised or
enjoyed, or on account of his having aided or encouraged, any other person in
the exercise or enjoyment of any right granted or protected by this chapter.
This section may be enforced by appropriate civil action. (2000 Code § 5-809)
5-10-9: PREVENTION OF INTIMIDATION IN FAIR HOUSING CASES:
   Whoever, whether or not acting under color of law, by force or threat of
force, wilfully injures, intimidates or interferes with or attempts to injure,
intimidate or interfere with:
   A.   Any person because of his race, gender, color, religion, national
origin, age, handicap or familial status and because he is or has been selling,
purchasing, renting financing, occupying or contracting or negotiating for the
sale, purchase, rental, financing or occupation of any dwelling or applying for
or participating in any service, organization or facility relating to the
business of selling or renting dwellings; or
   B.   Any person because he is or has been or in order to intimidate such
person or any other person or any class of persons from:
      1.   Participating without discrimination on account of race, gender,
color, religion, national origin, age, handicap or familial status in any of
the activities, services, organizations or facilities described in subsection A
of this section; or
      2.   Affording another person or class of persons opportunity or
protection so to participate.
   C.   Any citizen because he is or has been or in order to discourage such
citizen or any other citizen from lawfully aiding or encouraging other persons
to participate, without discrimination on account of race, gender, color,
religion, national origin, age, handicap or familial status, in any of the
activities, services, organizations or facilities described in this section, or
from participating lawfully in speech or peaceful assembly opposing any denial
of the opportunity to so participate shall be considered in violation of this
chapter. (2000 Code § 5-810; amd. Ord. 1057, 11-13-2007, eff. 11-13-2007)
5-10-10: PENALTY:
   It shall be unlawful and constitute an offense for any person to violate any
of the provisions of this chapter. Any person found guilty of violating any
provisions shall be deemed guilty of an offense, and is subject, upon
conviction, to a fine as provided in section 1-1-8 of this code. (2000 Code §
5-811)
CHAPTER 11
MOVING BUILDINGS
SECTION:
5-11-1: Permit Required
5-11-2: Permit Application; Fee
5-11-3: Bond
5-11-4: Liability Insurance
5-11-1: PERMIT REQUIRED:
   A.   Permit Required; Exceptions: It is unlawful for any person, as
principal, agent, laborer, servant or employee, to use or occupy any of the
streets, avenues or alleys, or other public places within the city limits for
the purpose of moving any building, structure or edifice or any other object or
thing, of any kind or character, to be used or placed herein for the purpose of
effecting the transportation of such structures, buildings, edifices or other
things as above described without having first obtained from the community
services office a permit for the purposes, which shall first have been approved
by the director of public works and the building inspector. No permit shall be
necessary to move buildings or other structures which are under thirteen and
one-half feet (131/2') in height, when loaded, and twelve feet (12') in width
and overall length of twenty feet (20'). No permit shall be issued for the
removal of any building exceeding twenty two feet (22') in height after the
building is loaded upon the equipment used in the removal of same or for any
building of over fifty five feet (55') in width or eighty feet (80') in length
with the overall length not to exceed eighty feet (80').
   B.   Plugging Sewer Service Line: No permit shall be issued to move any
building until the service sewer line from the building to be moved has been
plugged by a licensed plumber at the riser at a point not less than four feet
(4') deep from the surface of the ground. It shall be the duty of the owner of
any property from which the building was moved to fill up all holes and remove
any debris and trash from the premises.
   C.   Deposit Required For Cleanup Of Lot: The owner shall deposit with the
community services office, before removing the building, the sum of two hundred
fifty dollars ($250.00) as a guarantee that the lot will be cleaned up as above
stated, and in the event the owner does not clean up the lot within ten (10)
days after the removal of the building, the community services director is
authorized to clean up the lot and expend all or such portion of the two
hundred fifty dollar ($250.00) deposit to clean up the lot. However, in the
event the lot is cleaned up by the owner, the community services director will
refund the deposit. (2000 Code § 5-901; amd. Ord. 1057, 11-13-2007, eff. 11-13-
2007)
5-11-2: PERMIT APPLICATION; FEE:
   A.   Contents Of Application: The permit required by this chapter shall be
obtained on written application, which shall recite the character of the thing
or object to be moved and transported along or through and upon the streets,
avenues or alleys as aforesaid, the proposed route of such transportation and
the place or places where the equipment used in effecting such moving and
transporting shall be placed and secured.
   B.   Fee: The fee for such permit for removing any building shall be as set
by the council by motion or resolution. (2000 Code § 5-902)
5-11-3: BOND:
   No permit shall be issued until the applicant has deposited with the officer
issuing such permit a cash bond in such sum as may be reasonably necessary to
cover all loss or damage to streets or pavements by reason of any negligence or
improper occupancy of the streets, sidewalks and alleys. All such persons as
described herein, engaged as principals in the business herein described, in
addition to the cash bond deposit, shall deliver a surety bond in the sum of
five thousand dollars ($5,000.00) conditioned that such person shall save,
indemnify and keep harmless the city against any and all liabilities,
judgments, damages, costs and expenses which may in any way accrue against the
city in consequence of the granting of such permit, or while acting under the
same and will under all circumstances strictly comply with the terms of such
permit. Such surety bond shall not in any manner be affected or limited by the
cash deposit required herein. Any person as referred to herein, or his laborer,
servant, agent or employee shall cause a sufficient passageway to be kept open
for vehicles to pass on one side or both sides of any building, structure,
edifice, object or thing, while the same is being moved upon any street, avenue
or alley, if the character of same permits such, and when possible, the same
shall be kept moving each day without avoidable delay. (2000 Code § 5-903)
5-11-4: LIABILITY INSURANCE:
   A.   Insurance Required: Before any permit shall be issued to house movers,
every person obtaining such permit shall file with the city clerk, to be
approved by the mayor and council, an insurance policy for an indemnity fund as
hereinafter provided.
   B.   Conditions Of Policy: An insurance policy issued by the insurance
company licensed and authorized to do business in the state providing public
liability insurance coverage for each and every operation required in house
moving in the sum of fifty thousand dollars ($50,000.00) for every injury or
death of any one person and one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00) for the
injury or death of any number of persons in any one accident growing out of the
house moving and with the coverage of at least fifty thousand dollars
($50,000.00) for property damage in any one accident. The policy shall further
provide that it cannot be canceled until ten (10) days' written notice of such
cancellation has been given to the city clerk, and the policy shall carry an
endorsement of actual notice to the city for any change therein. The policy
shall be approved by the community services director and endorsed thereon. The
policy shall be made for the use and benefit and protection of any person or
property by reason of any accident or omission or negligence of any person
engaged in house moving. Such policy must be approved by the community services
director; and if approved, the policy shall remain in full force and effect
during the life of any such license issued. If after the approval of the policy
and after the issuance of the license, such policy shall be allowed to lapse or
shall not be renewed by the payment of premiums, the mayor and city council may
cancel any license issued under the provisions of this chapter, after notice to
the licensee and after an opportunity to be heard. The cancellation of any
policy shall in no way affect or terminate any liability arising prior to the
effective date of such cancellation. (2000 Code § 5-904; amd. Ord. 1057, 11-13-
2007, eff. 11-13-2007)
CHAPTER 12
EXISTING BUILDING CODE
SECTION:
5-12-1: Code Adopted
5-12-2: Revisions
5-12-1: CODE ADOPTED:
That a certain document, two copies of which are on file in the office of the
City Clerk of the City of Seminole, being marked and designated as the
International Existing Building Code, 2021 edition, including all Appendix
Chapters (see International Existing Building Code Section 101.6,2021 edition),
as published by the International Code Council, be and is hereby adopted as the
Existing Building Code of the City of Seminole, in the State of Oklahoma,
regulating and governing the repair, alteration, change of occupancy, addition
and relocation of existing buildings, including historic buildings, as herein
provided; providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees
therefor; and each and all of the regulations, provisions, penalties,
conditions and terms of said Existing Building Code on file in the office of
the City Clerk are hereby referred to, adopted and made a part hereof, as if
fully set out in this legislation, with the additions, insertions, deletions
and changes, if any, prescribed in Section
5-12-2 of this chapter. (Ord. 1189, 9-8-2015; amd. Ord. 1276, 11-8-2022)
5-12-2: REVISIONS:
That the following sections are hereby revised:
   Section 101.1 Insert City of Seminole.
   Section 1401.2 Insert January 1, 1980.
(Ord. 1189, 9-8-2015; amd. Ord. 1276, 11-8-2022)
TITLE 6
COURT
CHAPTER 1
MUNICIPAL COURT
SECTION:
6-1-1: Organization Of Court
6-1-2: Definitions
6-1-3: Jurisdiction Of Court
6-1-4: Municipal Court Judge
6-1-5: Disqualification Of Judge In Prosecutions
6-1-6: Principal Officer Of Court
6-1-7: Clerk Of The Court
6-1-8: Prosecuting Attorney; Duties; Conflict Of Interest
6-1-9: Rules Of Court
6-1-10: Written Complaints To Prosecute Violations
6-1-11: Procedures For Issuing Citation; Custody, Arrest
6-1-12: Creation Of Traffic Violations Bureau
6-1-13: Summons For Arrest
6-1-14: Form Of Arrest Warrant
6-1-15: Procedures For Bail Or Bond
6-1-16: Traffic Bail Bond Procedures
6-1-17: Bond Forfeiture; District Court
6-1-18: Arraignment And Pleadings By Defendant
6-1-19: Trials And Judgments
6-1-20: Trial By Jury Or Waiver
6-1-21: Jurors And Jury Trial Procedures
6-1-22: Witness Fees
6-1-23: Compensation Of Jurors
6-1-24: Sentencing
6-1-25: Complaint; Failure To Appear; Court Costs
6-1-26: Judgment
6-1-27: Imprisonment; Work By Prisoners
6-1-28: Costs And Administrative Fees
6-1-29: Penalty Assessment
6-1-1: ORGANIZATION OF COURT:
   This chapter shall govern the organization and operation of the municipal
court of the city of Seminole, as put into operation by resolution duly passed
on February 4, 1969, and filed in accordance with law as authorized by 11
Oklahoma Statutes sections 27-101 and 27-102. To the extent of conflict between
any provisions of this chapter and the provisions of any ordinance of this
city, the provisions of this chapter shall control. The court shall be
operative on and after February 12, 1969. (2000 Code § 6-101; amd. Ord. 1066,
1-8-2008, eff. 2-7-2008)
6-1-2: DEFINITIONS:
   As used in this chapter, unless the context requires a different meaning,
the following words shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section:
   CHIEF OF POLICE: The peace officer in charge of the police force of the
city.
   CLERK: The clerk of the city, including any deputy or member of the office
staff of the clerk while performing duties of the clerk's office.
   COURT: The municipal court of the city of Seminole.
   JUDGE: The judge of the municipal court, including any acting judge or
alternate judge thereof as provided for by the statutes of this state and this
chapter.
   THIS JUDICIAL DISTRICT: The district court judicial district of the state of
Oklahoma wherein the government of the city is situated. (2000 Code § 6-102;
amd. Ord. 1066, 1-8-2008, eff. 2-7-2008)
6-1-3: JURISDICTION OF COURT:
   The court shall exercise original jurisdiction to hear and determine all
prosecutions wherein a violation of any ordinance of the city is charged,
including any such prosecutions transferred to the court in accordance with
applicable law. (2000 Code § 6-103; amd. Ord. 1066, 1-8-2008, eff. 2-7-2008)
6-1-4: MUNICIPAL COURT JUDGE:
   A.   Qualifications: There shall be one judge of the court. A judge shall be
duly licensed to practice law in this state. He may engage in the practice of
law in other courts, but he shall not accept employment inconsistent with his
duties as judge, or arising out of facts which give rise to or are connected
with cases within the jurisdiction of the court, pending therein or which might
become the subject of proceedings therein. He must be a resident of the county.
(2000 Code § 6-104)
   B.   Term Of Office: The official term of the judge shall be two (2) years
expiring on January 15 in each odd numbered year. Each judge, unless sooner
removed for proper cause, shall serve until his successor is appointed and
qualified. (2000 Code § 6-105; amd. Ord. 1066, 1-8-2008, eff. 2-7-2008)
   C.   Alternate Judge: There shall be appointed for each judge of the court
an alternate judge possessed of the same qualifications as the judge. His
appointment shall be for the same term and made in the same manner as the
judge. He shall sit as acting judge of the court in any case if the judge is:
      1.   Absent from the court;
      2.   Unable to act as judge; or
      3.   Disqualified from acting as judge in the case. (2000 Code § 6-106)
   D.   Acting Judge: If at any time there is no judge or alternate judge, duly
appointed and qualified, available to sit as judge, the mayor shall appoint
some person, possessing the qualifications required by this chapter for the
judge, who shall preside as acting judge over the court in the disposition of
pending matters until such time as a judge or alternate judge shall be
available. (2000 Code § 6-107)
