Note:
   1.    All roll-offs and compactors per pull rates include up to 6 tons of
refuse. Any weight over 6 tons will be charged an additional $36.05 per ton.
   2.   The minimum and maximum fee or charge to be made and assessed each
owner or occupant thereof shall be fixed and set by the City Council according
to the amount of garbage, trash and debris collected on an average each month
for each individual premises or establishment as set out herein.
   B.   Business Establishments:
      1.   All containers shall be placed in a convenient and suitable place
holder for hydraulic lift equipment to be utilized during the waste collection
process. Each box or receptacle shall be equipped with approved top or lid and
approved lifting attachment.
      2.   Due to the weight and disposition of the commercial waste trucks, as
well as the frequency of pick-ups at the same location, the customer shall be
responsible for maintaining the driving surface and roadway base on their
property.
(Ord. 1224, 8-14-2018, eff. 8-14-2018; amd. Ord. 1269, 8-14-2022; Ord. 1290, 6-
13-2023; Ord. 1301, 5-14-2024)
17-4-9: MOBILE CONTAINERS PROVIDED BY CITY; REGULATIONS:
   A.   Rates And Charges:
      1.   For the purpose of defraying the expense of the collection of the
garbage and the removal of trash as in this section provided for, the Utility
Office is hereby authorized and directed to collect from the owner or occupant
of any premises in the City, the following assessment per month as may be
applicable:
         a.   A charge of seventeen dollars ninety cents ($17.90) for
residential curb service (per container).
         b.   A charge of twenty-one dollars and sixty-five cents ($21.65) for
each 95-gallon commercial curb service container.
         c.   A charge of one dollar and forty cents ($1.40) for residential
curbside bulk waste pickup as well as free landfill access. The bulk waste
pickup is the second full week of each month.
      2.   Garbage fees for multi-unit family dwellings on a master meter shall
be computed as follows:
   By each unit of a multi-family dwelling being charged under the schedule
listed in subsection A1 of this section, with the following exception:
   Eighty percent (80%) of the total number of units in the multi-family
dwelling where the occupancy has a tendency to substantially fluctuate shall be
used to arrive at a total billing. On master meters for multi- unit family
dwelling units where the occupancy does not have a tendency to substantially
fluctuate, the total of units shall be used to arrive at a total bill. "Multi-
unit family dwelling" shall be defined as including, but not limited to,
apartment complexes, triplexes, duplexes, rental homes and mobile home parks.
      3.   The rates specified herein are based on once a week collection.
   B.   Guidelines For Handling And Use Of Containers: It being the further
purpose of this section to set City guidelines for the use of, responsibility,
and handling of mobile garbage containers, the following shall apply:
      1.   Definitions: As used herein, the following terms shall have the
meanings respectively ascribed to them in this subsection:
   CARRYOUT SERVICE: Shall refer to a special category of service by the City
for qualified persons who are physically unable to move the mobile containers
to curbside.
   CURBSIDE SERVICE: Shall refer to pick up service provided by the City at the
curb or within the public street right-of-way.
   MOBILE CONTAINERS: Shall refer to any residential garbage container provided
by or approved by the City, including, but not limited to, "poly-karts".
      2.   Provided By City: The City shall provide one mobile container to
each residence on designated container routes. Containers are the property of
the City/contractor and shall remain at the assigned location regardless of
changes in ownership or occupancy of said residence.
      3.   Commercial Containers In Residential Areas: Commercial containers
are prohibited in residential areas except for roll- off service.
      4.   Curbside Service: In areas where mobile containers are provided by
the City, garbage service shall be curbside service only. It shall be the
responsibility of the resident to place the mobile container near the curb on
the day designated for pick up. Resident shall remove the container from
curbside on the same day.
      5.   Carryout Service: Carryout service shall be provided to residents
who are physically unable to place containers at curbside. This service will be
provided by City employees at no additional fee. The City reserves the right to
require a doctor's certificate as proof of resident's inability to place the
mobile container at curbside.
      6.   Additional Bags Of Garbage: In areas where mobile containers are
provided by the City, residents shall use those containers as their first means
of disposing of garbage. Additional garbage may be placed in plastic bags of
sufficient thickness to permit lifting and handling without breakage. Pick up
service will be limited to the mobile container and three (3) plastic bags
excepting as otherwise provided in this section.
      7.   Damaged Containers:
         a.   Mobile containers that are damaged, destroyed, or stolen shall be
repaired or replaced by the City at the expense of the resident or owner of the
residence.
         b.   Mobile containers that are damaged through normal and reasonable
usage will be repaired by the City at the City's expense.
      8.   Authorized Use By Businesses: Businesses collected on designated
mobile container routes shall not be provided mobile containers, unless usage
is authorized by the Director of Public Works and approved by the City Manager.
(Ord. 1224, 8-14-2018, eff. 8-14-2018; amd. Ord. 1290, 6-13-2023; Ord. 1301, 5-
14-2024)
17-4-10: LICENSING AND CONTRACTING AUTHORITY:
   The Mayor and Council shall have sole authority to license or contract for
the performance of all services pertaining to refuse collection and disposal.
All rules, regulations, and conduct of operations and all fees as provided for
in this chapter shall be as determined and prescribed by the Mayor and Council.
(2000 Code § 17-410)
17-4-11: VIOLATION; PENALTY:
A violation of any of the provisions of this chapter is a misdemeanor and any
person found guilty thereof shall be punished as provided in section 1-1-8 of
this Code. (2000 Code § 17-411)
CHAPTER 5
FIBER OPTIC AND COMMUNICATIONS INFRASTRUCTURE
SECTION:
17-5-1: Scope And Exceptions
17-5-2: Underground Placement Required
17-5-3: Design And Construction Standards
17-5-4: Obstruction Of Rights-Of-Way
17-5-5: GIS Location Requirement; Access
17-5-6: Construction Costs
17-5-7: Permitting Process
17-5-8: Right-Of-Way Maintenance
17-5-9: Removal Of Unauthorized Facilities
17-5-10: Variance Process
17-5-11: Penalty
17-5-1: SCOPE AND EXCEPTIONS:
   A.   It is found and determined by the City that the general public
necessity, convenience, health, safety, and welfare require that all new fiber
optic cable and/or other telecommunication networks providing broadband
internet services be constructed and maintained in an orderly manner within the
municipal boundaries in accordance with the requirements specified in this
chapter.
   B.   This chapter shall apply to all entities who own, operate or utilize
fiber optic cable networks or other communication facilities primarily utilized
for internet service within easements and public rights-of-way in the corporate
limits of the City of Seminole.
   C.   The chapter specifically excludes all telecommunication service
providers who currently own, operate or provide internet service within the
within easements and public rights-of-way in the corporate limits of the City
of Seminole and have been granted a non-exclusive franchise agreement with said
municipality.
   D.   Definitions. For purposes of this chapter, the following terms have the
meanings ascribed below:
 
                             Any fiber optic cable or other cable, wire or
                             lines designed for primarily for providing
FACILITIES:                  internet service, together with conductors,
                             switches, transformers, regulating devices and
                             other related equipment associated with the
                             provision of broadband internet services.
FIBER OPTIC CABLE:           A minimum count fiber cable bundle required to
                             provide ultrahigh speed broadband services
                             The minimum diameter of conduit used to enclose or
                             carry fiber optic cable or other wires or lines
                             and attendant parts and accessories buried
                             alongside a roadway or surface mounted on bridges,
FIBER OPTIC NETWORK CONDUIT: overpasses and other facilities where below-ground
                             placement is impossible or impractical, in
                             accordance with emerging industry standards or as
                             determined by the Director of Public Works or
                             authorized designee. (Ord. 1268, 6-14-2022)
 
17-5-2: UNDERGROUND PLACEMENT REQUIRED:
   A.   Unless specifically authorized by the City, all new fiber optic or
other cable, wire or line construction within the City limits shall be
installed and placed in conduit underground. The City may grant exceptions on a
case-by-case basis when underground installation is not practical. The
placement of above ground pedestals, meter bases and related equipment shall be
permitted only as specifically set forth in approved permits and only at the
direction of the City with respect to an acceptable location for such
facilities.
   B.   Service connections are facilities extending from a distribution system
and terminating on private property to serve a customer or subscriber. Service
connections may be above ground or below ground as designated by the owner of
the real property to be served. All new service connections installed below
ground must be placed in conduit.
   C.   Nothing herein shall require any existing above ground equipment or
facilities to be relocated rearranged or modified to be placed underground
However, service providers are encouraged to bury any existing communication
facilities should any relocation or modification be necessitated due to any
renovation, repair, or upgrade. (Ord. 1268, 6-14-2022)
17-5-3: DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION STANDARDS:
   A.   All cable, wire, lines, conductors, switches, transformers, regulating
devices and other related equipment shall be installed to meet or exceed
specifications of emerging industry standards for provision of ultra-speed
broadband service. At a minimum, design, construction and equipment must
satisfy applicable national, state, and local laws and regulations. All
structures housing devices shall be designed in accordance with the provisions
of the International Building Code and municipal code provisions.
   B.   All applicable entities who are responsible for installing, operating
and maintaining the network infrastructure shall observe compliance with all
applicable regulations of the City, which may be amended from time to time, and
in such manner that its operations will not interfere with any installations of
the City or of a public utility serving the City.
   C.   Construction operations shall consist of, and employ, the highest
degree of care as is commensurate with the practical operation of its business
and shall install and maintain in use commonly accepted methods and devices for
preventing failures and accidents which are likely to cause damage, injuries or
nuisances to the public, as well as result in the least amount of damage and
disruption to the rights-of-ways.
   D.   The City reserves the right to require the use of "trenchless
technology" which includes directional drilling or directional boring for any
portion of construction or maintenance projects which lie beneath any paved or
improved portion of any roadway, right-of-way or other specified area. City
further may require trenchless technology in other locations, where
circumstances prevent or make open-cut methods impractical. (Ord. 1268, 6-14-
2022)
17-5-4: OBSTRUCTIONS OF RIGHTS-OF-WAY:
   A.   Except in the case of an emergency, or with the approval of the City,
no obstruction or excavation easements or public rights-of-way may be performed
when circumstances prohibit a safe environment or when conditions are
unreasonable for such work.
   B.   Rights-of-way shall not be obstructed so as to interfere with the
natural, free and clear passage of water through the gutters, drains, ditches
or other waterways. Streets and thoroughfares shall be cleared of any drill
mud, debris and other obstructions that accumulate as a result of the
construction activities, and construction personnel will not permit its
activities to create a hazard to any persons or property. (Ord. 1268, 6-14-
2022)
17-5-5: GlS LOCATION REQUIREMENT; ACCESS:
   A.   Whenever fiber optic network conduit and/or fiber optic cable
installed, it shall be required for standard GIS locating devices or technology
be installed to identify and locate said buried cable, wire, lines and other
related equipment throughout the provider's network infrastructure unless it
can be demonstrated to the reasonable satisfaction of the City that such
requirement is not technologically feasible or reasonably practicable or such
provider is exempt or otherwise not required to comply by operation of law.
   B.   All location data, as well as a comprehensive map designating the
location of all above ground and below ground conduit and equipment shall be
provided to the City. (Ord. 1268, 6-14-2022)
17-5-6: CONSTRUCTION COSTS:
The cost of constructing and installing said facilities shall be borne by the
serving utilities, the owners of the real property to be served, or others
requesting placement of underground facilities in accordance with the
applicable rules, regulations, and policies of the respective utilities
furnishing such service. (Ord. 1268, 6-14-2022)
17-5-7: PERMITTING PROCESS:
   A.   Prior to the installation of any fiber optic cable and/or communication
facilities, the installer must submit plans describing the facilities to be
installed and the location of the installation to the Department of Public
Works. Upon review and approval, City will issue a permit upon application
authorizing the installation of the facilities to proceed. No facilities shall
be installed without the prior approval of the Director of Public Works or
authorized designee. All required permit fees and/or other required costs shall
be paid upon submitting said application.
   B.   All construction or operations within the City shall be duly authorized
to do business in Oklahoma and shall have received any necessary certificate of
public convenience and necessity or other required authorization from the
Federal Communications Commission (FCC) or other authorized regulatory body,
and all requisite State and City licensing for the work to be performed.
   C.   The Director of Public Works or Code Enforcement Office and other
designated personnel in the service of the municipal may inspect any location
or premises at any reasonable times for purpose of inspection and to ensure
compliance with the provisions of this code. City may require the responsible
party to alter or modify its facilities to serve the needs and objectives of
the City or for the public good.
   D.   The licensee shall secure and maintain required liability insurance
policies specified by the City. However, a Licensee may declare itself as self-
insured. If so, the licensee shall provide the City evidence sufficient to
demonstrate its financial ability to self-insure the insurance coverage for the
limit required. (Ord. 1268, 6-14-2022)
17-5-8: RIGHT-OF-WAY MAINTENANCE:
   A.   Surface maintenance within dedicated public right-of-ways encompassing
said facilities shall be the responsibility of the City, which shall include
mowing, trimming, vegetation and erosion control. The City shall be responsible
to exercise reasonable and sufficient maintenance in a manner to ensure the
safe and efficient operation of said network infrastructure. The City shall use
due care to ensure that no damage, beyond reasonable wear and tear, is caused
to said maintained areas or Licensee's equipment. Nothing shall require the
City to provide maintenance of items typically reserved for overhead electric
utilities, such as tree trimming, pruning or removal.
   B.   All service providers shall be responsible for paying a right-of-way
maintenance fee on an annual basis to reimburse the City for costs associated
with maintaining the property subject to this chapter. Said fee rate shall be
established by the City as authorized by
17-1-5 of the Code of Ordinances. In no event shall said fee exceed five
percent (5%) of gross revenues collected by a Licensee by customers located
within the municipality during each calendar year of operation. (Ord. 1268, 6-
14-2022)
17-5-9: REMOVAL OF UNAUTHORIZED FACILITIES:
   A.   Within thirty (30) days following written notice from the City, the
Licensee shall, at its own expense, remove all or any part of any unauthorized
facilities or appurtenances from the easements and public rights-of-way. A
facility is unauthorized and subject to removal in the following circumstances:
      1.   Upon expiration or termination of a License Agreement or permit
obtained by the Licensee, unless otherwise permitted by applicable law;
      2.   If the facility was constructed or installed without the prior grant
of a license or permit;
      3.   If the facility was constructed, installed or maintained in
violation of any franchise or licensing agreement or established standards
required herein; or
      4.   If the facility was constructed or installed at a location not
permitted by any permit obtained by the Licensee.
   B.   If a Licensee installs any facilities within any applicable location
without a permit for said location, the Licensee agrees to pay an
administrative penalty to the City in the sum of One Thousand Dollars
($1,000.00) per month due on the first day of each month regardless of the
amount of time the Licensee's facilities remain in the non-permitted area
during that month until removed or permission is acquired. Payment of the
penalty shall not authorize the presence of any facilities in the specific site
without a permit. No action or inaction by the City with respect to
unauthorized use of any public right-of-way shall be deemed a ratification or
an unauthorized use. (Ord. 1268, 6-14-2022)
17-5-10: VARIANCE PROCESS:
Any entity affected by this chapter may apply to the City Council for a
variance from the provisions of this chapter. The Council may, in its sole
discretion, grant relief from the terms of this chapter. (Ord. 1268, 6-14-2022)
17-5-11: PENALTY:
Any person, firm, entity or corporation violating any provision of this
Ordinance, as it exists or may be amended, shall be deemed guilty of a
misdemeanor be punished as provided in section 11-8 of this Code. Each
continuing day's violation shall constitute a separate offense. The penalties
provided herein shall not preclude the City from initiating administrative or
civil action to enjoin the violation. The City retains all legal rights and
remedies available to it pursuant to local, state and federal law. (Ord. 1268,
6-14-2022)
